vocabulary.definition: to treat an object as if it were human, even though it's not
vocabulary.example: The children anthropomorphised their pet robot, giving it a name and talking to it like a friend.

vocabulary.definition: relating to the mental processes of knowing, learning, and understanding
vocabulary.example: Studying a new language involves various cognitive processes such as memory and problem-solving.

vocabulary.definition: thinking that something unlikely will happen in the future
vocabulary.example: Believing that aliens will visit Earth one day is just wishful thinking without any evidence.

vocabulary.definition: surprised in a negative way by something unexpected
vocabulary.example: She was blindsided by the sudden news of her job termination.

vocabulary.definition: computer programmes designed to interact with humans over the internet
vocabulary.example: Many businesses use chatbots on their websites to assist customers with inquiries.
The scam artist deceived many people into investing in a fake company.
